# iosxr_ftp (Resource)

This resource can manage the FTP configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxr_ftp" "example" {
  client_vrfs = [
    {
      vrf_name           = "VRF1"
      passive            = true
      source_interface   = "Loopback0"
      anonymous_password = "mypassword"
      username           = "ftpuser"
      password           = "myencryptedpassword"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `client_vrfs` (Attributes List) VRF name for FTP service (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--client_vrfs))
- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--client_vrfs"></a>
### Nested Schema for `client_vrfs`

Required:

- `vrf_name` (String) VRF name for FTP service

Optional:

- `anonymous_password` (String, Sensitive) Specify a password for anonymous users
- `passive` (Boolean) Connect using passive mode
- `password` (String, Sensitive) Specify an encrypted password
- `source_interface` (String) Specify interface for source address in FTP connections
- `username` (String) Specify username for FTP connections

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxr_ftp.example ""
```
